intro: Microgynoecium tibeticum, commonly known as the Tibetan microgynoecium, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic compounds. The plant exhibits a unique botanical structure, with a reduced gynoecium that is typically composed of a single carpel. Its morphology is adapted to the harsh, cold, and arid conditions of its alpine habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is of particular interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and biodiversity in extreme environments.
